Section Title: MANAGEMENT’S DISCUSSION AND ANALYSIS OF FINANCIAL CONDITION AND RESULTS OF OPERATIONS
MANAGEMENT’S DISCUSSION AND ANALYSIS OF FINANCIAL CONDITION AND RESULTS OF OPERATIONS
Subsubsection Text: During the fiscal year ended July 31, 2023, our total revenue increased by 8.9%, or €33.6 million, to €410.9 million, compared to €377.3 million for the fiscal year ended July 31, 2022. The increase in our total Group revenue is mainly due to the growth in our network sales compared to the prior year. Our revenue also benefitted from a higher contribution of franchisees’ sales (increased by 0.4% over the period) related to the increase of the communication budget in France. The rest of our revenues were broadly aligned with our network performance. The following table sets forth a breakdown of our revenue by geographic segment for the periods indicated.

Section Title: MANAGEMENT’S DISCUSSION AND ANALYSIS OF FINANCIAL CONDITION AND RESULTS OF OPERATIONS
Subsubsection Text: (1) Following our decision to progressively discontinue our Optical Discount brand, which resulted in a reduction to 22 stores bearing the Optical Discount banner as at July 31, 2023, Optical Discount activities (which we plan to progressively terminate by the end of 2024) are treated as discontinued operations in the audited consolidated financial statements for our fiscal year ended July 31, 2023 and our unaudited condensed interim consolidated financial information for the nine months ended April 30, 2024. For comparison purposes, the comparative income statement and statement of cash flows columns setting forth our financial information for the fiscal year ended July 31, 2022 and the nine months ended April 30, 2023 were restated with Optical Discount as discontinued operations. No restatement of balance sheet information was performed in accordance with IFRS 5. For further information, see “—Factors affecting _the comparability of our results of operations—Changes in our scope of consolidation” and note 4.3.1 to our audited_ consolidated financial statements for the fiscal year ended July 31, 2023 included elsewhere in this Offering Memorandum. (2) For the fiscal year ended July 31, 2022, gross profit was €191.7 million (restated), and for the fiscal year ended July 31, 2023, gross profit was €208.4 million, corresponding to 23.2% and 23.8% of network sales, respectively.

Section Title: MANAGEMENT’S DISCUSSION AND ANALYSIS OF FINANCIAL CONDITION AND RESULTS OF OPERATIONS
Subsection Title: For the fiscal year ended July 31, 2022

Section Title: MANAGEMENT’S DISCUSSION AND ANALYSIS OF FINANCIAL CONDITION AND RESULTS OF OPERATIONS
Subsubsection Text: Over the fiscal year ended July 31, 2023, cost of purchases increased by €16.9 million, or 9.1%, from €185.6 million for the fiscal year ended July 31, 2022 to €202.5 million for the fiscal year ended July 31, 2023. The increase is broadly consistent with the growth in network sales while being affected in the last quarter by lower levels of exclusive brands purchases.

Section Title: MANAGEMENT’S DISCUSSION AND ANALYSIS OF FINANCIAL CONDITION AND RESULTS OF OPERATIONS
Subsubsection Title: Duties and taxes other than income tax
Subsubsection Text: Duties and taxes other than income tax represented an expense of €2.7 million for the fiscal year ended July 31, 2023, compared to €2.6 million for the fiscal year ended July 31, 2022. These changes are mainly linked to the directly-owned stores perimeter evolution.

Section Title: MANAGEMENT’S DISCUSSION AND ANALYSIS OF FINANCIAL CONDITION AND RESULTS OF OPERATIONS
Subsubsection Title: Wages and salaries including social security contributions
Subsubsection Text: Wages and salaries, including social security contributions, increased by €4.8 million, or 7.9%, from €61.5 million for the fiscal year ended July 31, 2022 to €66.4 million for the fiscal year ended July 31, 2023. Our personnel costs in both periods generally followed network sales growth, apart from our hearing aids business, where we continued to reinforce our team to accompany the overall expansion of this business in our main geographies. Our headcount decreased to 1,414 employees at July 31, 2023, compared to 1,438 employees at July 31, 2022, mainly due to the sale back of stores in our directly-owned stores portfolio, which took place during the fiscal year.

Section Title: MANAGEMENT’S DISCUSSION AND ANALYSIS OF FINANCIAL CONDITION AND RESULTS OF OPERATIONS
Subsubsection Text: Other purchases and external expenses increased over the fiscal year ended July 31, 2023 by €3.7 million from €22.8 million for the fiscal year ended July 31, 2022 to €26.6 million for the fiscal year ended July 31, 2023. This evolution is linked to several items, including the non-renewal of rebates obtained a year before on rents supported during the COVID-19 pandemic (€0.7 million), charges linked to the move of our headquarters to La Défense (€0.2 million), higher travel expenses and corporate events (€0.3 million), and a specific effort to develop our training programs dedicated to directly-owned stores and the whole network (€0.4 million), the rest of the evolution being broadly aligned with the overall growth of our revenue. The total increase during the fiscal year includes one-off items totaling approximately €1.0 million. -----

Section Title: MANAGEMENT’S DISCUSSION AND ANALYSIS OF FINANCIAL CONDITION AND RESULTS OF OPERATIONS
Subsubsection Text: Depreciation, amortization and impairment represented a net expense of €31.8 million for the fiscal year ended July 31, 2023, compared to a net expense of €28.0 million for the fiscal year ended July 31, 2022. The difference is primarily linked to higher charges at our franchisor business; while our directlyowned store structure recorded limited growth and a decline in the last quarter, the perimeter of our directly-owned stores slightly decreased in the fiscal year ended July 31, 2022. The amortization of our fixed assets which includes our right-of-use assets, grew by €4.3 million during the year, while the net flow of provisions was positive due to the overall soundness of our franchisees and a reversal of provisions following a write-off on our inventories. The amortization expense on the right-of-use assets included an increase of €1.0 million during the fiscal year ended July 31, 2023 to €15.6 million, from €14.6 million during the fiscal year ended July 31, 2022, as a consequence of: (i) a larger directly-owned store perimeter, and (ii) our new premises in La Défense. On the other side, the depreciation of our assets in the fiscal year continued to grow at our franchisor business in relation to the continued digital transformation plan, and more recently through supporting the rollout of teleophthalmology by our franchisees.

Section Title: MANAGEMENT’S DISCUSSION AND ANALYSIS OF FINANCIAL CONDITION AND RESULTS OF OPERATIONS
Subsubsection Text: As a result of the factors discussed above, operating income from ordinary activities increased by €4.3 million, or 5.7%, from €76.7 million for the fiscal year ended July 31, 2022 to €81.0 million for the fiscal year ended July 31, 2023.

Section Title: MANAGEMENT’S DISCUSSION AND ANALYSIS OF FINANCIAL CONDITION AND RESULTS OF OPERATIONS
Subsubsection Text: Other non-recurring operating items expense increased by €1.3 million from €3.9 million for the fiscal year ended July 31, 2022 to €5.1 million for the fiscal year ended July 31, 2023. This increase relates mainly to impairment of owned stores, principally including a depreciation on Optical Discount stores.

Section Title: MANAGEMENT’S DISCUSSION AND ANALYSIS OF FINANCIAL CONDITION AND RESULTS OF OPERATIONS
Subsubsection Text: As a result of the factors discussed above, operating profit increased by €3.1 million, or 4.2%, from €72.8 million for the fiscal year ended July 31, 2022 to €75.9 million for the fiscal year ended July 31, 2023.

Section Title: MANAGEMENT’S DISCUSSION AND ANALYSIS OF FINANCIAL CONDITION AND RESULTS OF OPERATIONS
Subsubsection Text: Net financial expense decreased by €5.0 million from €48.2 million for the fiscal year ended July 31, 2022 to €43.2 million for the fiscal year ended July 31, 2023. Throughout the fiscal year, borrowing costs decreased to €42.3 million, from €48.0 million a year before, mainly as a consequence of a decrease of €10.0 million in capitalized interest on our convertible bonds, which have been either fully reimbursed or converted as at July 31, 2023. However, despite this overall decrease, we recorded the following changes to our financial expense over the period: (i) the cost of our high-yield debt increased by €2.7 million due to the full-year impact of adding on €50 million of Existing Senior Secured Notes issued in January 2022, (ii) interest charges on our floating rate notes increased as a result of the increase in the Euribor interest rate, and (iii) our leases generated €1.2 million in additional expense compared to the prior year, linked to a growth of our total lease debt. Our other financial expenses and our investment income evolution were broadly balanced in both periods by the increase in our investment income, due to our hedging activity, and increased income as a result of additional balances. -----

Section Title: MANAGEMENT’S DISCUSSION AND ANALYSIS OF FINANCIAL CONDITION AND RESULTS OF OPERATIONS
Subsubsection Title: Net income before tax of consolidated companies
Subsubsection Text: The Group generated net income before tax of consolidated companies and tax expense of €32.7 million for the fiscal year ended July 31, 2023, from an income of €24.6 million for the fiscal year ended July 31, 2022.

Section Title: MANAGEMENT’S DISCUSSION AND ANALYSIS OF FINANCIAL CONDITION AND RESULTS OF OPERATIONS
Subsubsection Text: We recorded an income tax expense of €10.5 million for the fiscal year ended July 31, 2023, compared to an expense of €12.7 million for the prior fiscal year. The tax expense related to the positive evolution of our profitability on the whole fiscal year.

Section Title: MANAGEMENT’S DISCUSSION AND ANALYSIS OF FINANCIAL CONDITION AND RESULTS OF OPERATIONS
Subsubsection Text: As a result of the factors discussed above, our results from continuing operations increased by €10.3 million, from an income of €11.9 million for the fiscal year ended July 31, 2022, to an income of €22.2 million for the fiscal year ended July 31, 2023.

Section Title: MANAGEMENT’S DISCUSSION AND ANALYSIS OF FINANCIAL CONDITION AND RESULTS OF OPERATIONS
Subsubsection Text: Following the decision to progressively discontinue our Optical Discount brand, the Group restated the Optical Discount brand as discontinued operations, no longer taking into account its commercial performance both in store count and network sales, so that our network now only consists of ALAIN AFFLELOU points of sale, either in the hearing aid or in the optical business. In accordance with IFRS, the Group restated its financial statements in the fiscal year ended July 31, 2022, as if the discount activities had already been treated as discontinued operations in the previous fiscal year. As a consequence, the Group recorded a €1.2 million loss in discontinued operations in the fiscal year ended July 31, 2023, compared to a €1.8 million loss in the fiscal year ended July 31, 2022.

Section Title: MANAGEMENT’S DISCUSSION AND ANALYSIS OF FINANCIAL CONDITION AND RESULTS OF OPERATIONS
Subsubsection Text: As a result of the factors discussed above, our net income increased by €10.9 million to a net income of €21.0 million for the fiscal year ended July 31, 2023, compared to a net income of €10.1 million for the fiscal year ended July 31, 2022.

Section Title: MANAGEMENT’S DISCUSSION AND ANALYSIS OF FINANCIAL CONDITION AND RESULTS OF OPERATIONS
Subsubsection Text: (1) Excluding Optical Discount. _France_ Revenue in France during the fiscal year ended July 31, 2023 increased by 8.3% or €23.9 million, from €287.0 million for the fiscal year ended July 31, 2022 to €310.9 million. Our revenue benefitted during the period from the increase of our communication budget by 0.4% from 8.4% to 8.8%. The revenue growth over this period was aligned with network sales, including our directly-owned stores, except with ----- respect to our exclusive products, which reflected a slight reduction in sales in the last quarter of the fiscal year ended July 31, 2023 as a result of our decision to postpone the release of our new collection for several weeks. _Spain_ During the fiscal year ended July 31, 2023, our revenue in Spain recorded growth of 11.3% to €82.9 million compared to €74.5 million for the fiscal year ended July 31, 2022, closely tracking the evolution of our network sales, which grew by 10.5% over the same period. _Other countries_ Our revenue in the fiscal year ended July 31, 2023 recorded 8.2% growth to €17.1 million, compared to €15.8 million in the fiscal year ended July 31, 2022. Our directly-owned stores portfolio, which includes six stores in Portugal, demonstrated a positive revenue evolution, contributing to a slightly higher revenue growth of Other countries than the growth in total network sales.

Section Title: MANAGEMENT’S DISCUSSION AND ANALYSIS OF FINANCIAL CONDITION AND RESULTS OF OPERATIONS
Subsubsection Text: During the fiscal year ended July 31, 2022, the Group’s revenue recorded a 5.1% or €18.6 million growth at €383.8 million, compared to €365.3 million a year before. The increase in our Group’s revenue is mainly linked to the expansion of our directly-owned stores portfolio, at 183 stores as at July 31, 2022, compared to 160 stores as at July 31, 2021. This expansion stems from the buyback of two franchisee perimeters accounting for 20 stores and representing €17.0 million of annual sales, in Normandy (January 2022) and in Bordeaux (October 2021). Also, our directly-owned stores recorded good performances in the prior fiscal year due to a rebound compared to the prior year, when a number of those stores were impacted by restriction measures in shopping centers. The rest of our revenue recorded a slight growth, mitigated by lower revenue at our discount activity, following the sharp reduction at the Optical Discount perimeter, with a marginal impact on the Group’s profitability, given its limited contribution. The following table sets forth a breakdown of our revenue by geographic segment for the periods indicated.

Section Title: MANAGEMENT’S DISCUSSION AND ANALYSIS OF FINANCIAL CONDITION AND RESULTS OF OPERATIONS
Subsubsection Text: Cost of purchases increased slightly by €4.1 million, or 2.2%, from €185.2 million for the fiscal year ended July 31, 2021 to €189.4 million for the fiscal year ended July 31, 2022. This evolution is consistent ----- with the network’s activity evolution and the specific impact of our perimeter expansion at our directlyowned stores.

Section Title: MANAGEMENT’S DISCUSSION AND ANALYSIS OF FINANCIAL CONDITION AND RESULTS OF OPERATIONS
Subsubsection Title: Wages and salaries, including social security contributions
Subsubsection Text: Wages and salaries, including social security contributions, increased by €2.4 million, or 4.1%, from €60.2 million for the fiscal year ended July 31, 2021 to €62.7 million for the fiscal year ended July 31, 2022. Our headcount grew to 1,438 employees at July 31, 2022, compared to 1,298 employees at July 31, 2021, mainly due to the increase of 23 stores in our owned portfolio. Despite the 10.8% growth in the headcount, wages and salaries, including social security contributions, only increased by 4.1% due to the combination of the following: (i) personnel costs at our headquarters include management exit bonuses, which were lower this year, and generated savings of €2.7 million compared to the year before, while the evolution of our franchise business was well managed, in a context of broader services brought to our network, like the support of our team dedicated to the digital transformation and (ii) on the other hand, personnel costs at our directly-owned stores generated an additional charge due to the store count expansion. The two formerly franchisee-operated perimeters bought back were well managed and allowed us to reduce the total personnel costs at 28.1% of our directly-owned stores sales compared to 30.6% a year before.

Section Title: MANAGEMENT’S DISCUSSION AND ANALYSIS OF FINANCIAL CONDITION AND RESULTS OF OPERATIONS
Subsubsection Text: Other purchases and external expenses increased over the fiscal year by €1.7 million from €22.7 million for the fiscal year ended July 31, 2021 to €24.5 million for the fiscal year ended July 31, 2022. These charges are mainly linked to the expansion of our directly-owned stores.

Section Title: MANAGEMENT’S DISCUSSION AND ANALYSIS OF FINANCIAL CONDITION AND RESULTS OF OPERATIONS
Subsubsection Title: Duties and taxes other than income tax
Subsubsection Text: Duties and taxes other than income tax represented an expense of €2.6 million for the fiscal year ended July 31, 2022, compared to an expense of €2.2 million for the fiscal year ended July 31, 2021. This increase is mainly linked to the directly-owned stores perimeter evolution, as our owned stores generally support a significant level of local taxes.

Section Title: MANAGEMENT’S DISCUSSION AND ANALYSIS OF FINANCIAL CONDITION AND RESULTS OF OPERATIONS
Subsubsection Text: Depreciation, amortization and impairment represented a net expense of €27.7 million for the fiscal year ended July 31, 2022, compared to a net expense of €21.8 million for the fiscal year ended July 31, 2021. The difference was mainly driven, on one side, by the expansion of our D.O.S perimeter, totaling during the fiscal year an additional depreciation of tangible assets at our owned stores of €2.4 million, and on the other side, an increase of €1.9 million on depreciation of assets at our franchisor business related to the continued digital transformation plan. In addition to higher depreciation of our assets, the Group recorded during the fiscal year a net reversal of provisions, for €0.8 million, related to continued financial soundness of our franchisees; meanwhile, the year before was marked by a high level of reversal of provisions of €2.5 million on inventories and franchisee receivables.

Section Title: MANAGEMENT’S DISCUSSION AND ANALYSIS OF FINANCIAL CONDITION AND RESULTS OF OPERATIONS
Subsubsection Text: As a result of the factors discussed above, operating income from ordinary activities increased by €3.8 million, or 5.2%, from €73.1 million for the fiscal year ended July 31, 2021 to €77.0 million for the fiscal year ended July 31, 2022. -----

Section Title: MANAGEMENT’S DISCUSSION AND ANALYSIS OF FINANCIAL CONDITION AND RESULTS OF OPERATIONS
Subsubsection Text: Other non-recurring operating items expense decreased by €0.8 million, from €7.3 million for the fiscal year ended July 31, 2021, to €6.5 million for the fiscal year ended July 31, 2022. This expense relates mainly to owned stores impairment, and, on the other side, to a further goodwill depreciation on the Optical Discount brand, in accordance with the sharp reduction of its perimeter and our recent decision to terminate franchise agreements that do not correspond to our requirements and to stop our development of the Optical Discount brand, and only focus on ALAIN AFFLELOU for our expansion.

Section Title: MANAGEMENT’S DISCUSSION AND ANALYSIS OF FINANCIAL CONDITION AND RESULTS OF OPERATIONS
Subsubsection Text: As a result of the factors discussed above, operating profit increased by €4.6 million, or 7.0%, from €65.8 million for the fiscal year ended July 31, 2021 to €70.4 million for the fiscal year ended July 31, 2022.

Section Title: MANAGEMENT’S DISCUSSION AND ANALYSIS OF FINANCIAL CONDITION AND RESULTS OF OPERATIONS
Subsubsection Text: Net financial expense decreased by €16.4 million from €64.5 million for the fiscal year ended July 31, 2021 to €48.2 million for the fiscal year ended July 31, 2022. The fourth quarter of the fiscal year ended July 31, 2021 was marked by the Group’s refinancing of €410.0 million of senior secured notes maturing in 2026 bearing 4.25% of fixed interest rate and €75.0 million of senior notes maturing in 2027 at EURIBOR +8.0%, which enabled the Group to reimburse €135.0 million of convertible bonds to shareholders. Moreover, the Group issued additional senior secured notes at the beginning of 2022 in an aggregate principal amount of €50.0 million, simultaneously with the conversion of €140.0 million of convertible bonds held by shareholders, and a distribution to shareholders of €59.2 million. After those transactions, the amount of convertible bonds that bear capitalized interest has been sharply reduced to an outstanding amount of €39.3 million, as at July 31, 2022, resulting in savings of €19.3 million compared to the prior year.

Section Title: MANAGEMENT’S DISCUSSION AND ANALYSIS OF FINANCIAL CONDITION AND RESULTS OF OPERATIONS
Subsubsection Title: Net income (loss) before tax of consolidated companies
Subsubsection Text: As a result of the foregoing, the Group generated a net income before tax of consolidated companies and tax expense of €22.2 million for the fiscal year ended July 31, 2022, from an income of €1.3 million in the fiscal year ended July 31, 2021.

Section Title: MANAGEMENT’S DISCUSSION AND ANALYSIS OF FINANCIAL CONDITION AND RESULTS OF OPERATIONS
Subsubsection Text: We recorded an income tax expense of €12.1 million for the fiscal year ended July 31, 2022, compared to an expense of €40.2 million the year before. The tax expense related to the positive evolution of our profitability on the whole fiscal year.

Section Title: MANAGEMENT’S DISCUSSION AND ANALYSIS OF FINANCIAL CONDITION AND RESULTS OF OPERATIONS
Subsubsection Text: As a result of the factors discussed above, our result from continuing operations increased by €49.0 million, from a loss of €38.9 million for the fiscal year ended July 31, 2021, to an income of €10.1 million for the fiscal year ended July 31, 2022.

Section Title: MANAGEMENT’S DISCUSSION AND ANALYSIS OF FINANCIAL CONDITION AND RESULTS OF OPERATIONS

Our directly-owned stores portfolio, composed of six stores in Portugal, showed a satisfactory evolution as a future base for our expansion locally.

Section Title: MANAGEMENT’S DISCUSSION AND ANALYSIS OF FINANCIAL CONDITION AND RESULTS OF OPERATIONS
MANAGEMENT’S DISCUSSION AND ANALYSIS OF FINANCIAL CONDITION AND RESULTS OF OPERATIONS
Subsubsection Text: Revenue increased to €312.6 million, or 4.9%, for the nine months ended April 30, 2024, from €297.9 million for the nine months ended April 30, 2023. This was due to an increase at a comparable level to the total network sales growth of 5.4%. _France_ Revenue generated in France increased from €226.7 million for the nine months ended April 30, 2023 to €236.1 million for the nine months ended April 30, 2024. The increase is primarily due to strong network performance at our historical optical banner compared to the prior year. In addition to the strong performance at our optical network, network sales at our hearing aid banner started to recover and generated growing revenues. Finally, our directly-owned stores generated slightly lower revenues compared to the nine months ended April 30, 2023, mainly due to the reduction of our directly-owned stores perimeter. _Spain_ Revenue in Spain grew by 8.7%, from €59.1 million for the nine months ended April 30, 2023 to €64.3 million for the nine months ended April 30, 2024. This increase reflects the growth of our hearing aid network sales, as well as strong sales at our historical banner, and grew at consistent levels with network sales, which recorded an 8.3% growth. As was the case in France, our revenue stemming from our communications also recorded a higher growth than total network sales due to large communication campaigns during this period. Revenues at our directly-owned stores were broadly aligned with the network’s activity. ----- _Other countries_ Revenue generated by the Other countries segment recorded a total growth of 1.2% at €12.2 million for the nine months ended April 30, 2024. Our revenue was broadly aligned with network sales, but was affected by lower communication revenues as a consequence of lower communication activity due to the phasing of our communication campaign schedule.

Section Title: MANAGEMENT’S DISCUSSION AND ANALYSIS OF FINANCIAL CONDITION AND RESULTS OF OPERATIONS
Subsubsection Text: Cost of purchases grew by 5.4% to €154.1 million for the nine months ended April 30, 2024, compared to €146.2 million for the nine months ended April 30, 2023. Cost of purchases were at a level aligned with our revenue and total network sales.

Section Title: MANAGEMENT’S DISCUSSION AND ANALYSIS OF FINANCIAL CONDITION AND RESULTS OF OPERATIONS
Subsubsection Title: Wages and salaries, including social security contributions
Subsubsection Text: Wages and salaries, including social security contributions increased by 6.9% or €3.4 million from €48.8 million for the nine months ended April 30, 2023 to €52.2 million for the nine months ended April 30, 2024. Personnel costs at our headquarters and our franchisor activities increased consistently with network sales restated from the allocation of free shares to managers representing a charge of €1.8 million under IFRS2 rules for the nine months ended April 30, 2024.

Section Title: MANAGEMENT’S DISCUSSION AND ANALYSIS OF FINANCIAL CONDITION AND RESULTS OF OPERATIONS
Subsubsection Text: Other purchases and external expenses increased €20.6 million for the nine months ended April 30, 2024 from €19.6 million for the nine months ended April 30, 2023. The total percentage increase in other purchases was well managed, with slightly lower growth than our network sales.

Section Title: MANAGEMENT’S DISCUSSION AND ANALYSIS OF FINANCIAL CONDITION AND RESULTS OF OPERATIONS
Subsubsection Title: Duties and taxes other than income tax
Subsubsection Text: Duties and taxes other than income tax increased to €2.3 million for the nine months ended April 30, 2024. Expenses for our directly-owned stores recorded were slightly lower as a consequence of the reduction of our directly-owned perimeter from a year before.

Section Title: MANAGEMENT’S DISCUSSION AND ANALYSIS OF FINANCIAL CONDITION AND RESULTS OF OPERATIONS
Subsubsection Text: Depreciation, amortization and impairment represented an expense of €25.1 million for the nine months ended April 30, 2024, compared to an expense of €23.8 million for the nine months ended April 30, 2023. Amortization of assets grew by €1.2 million during the nine months ended April 30, 2024, primarily as a consequence of the overall reduction of our directly-owned stores perimeter, while the amortization expense continued to grow at the franchisor business and at our headquarters as a consequence of our initiatives, like digital transformation and the support of the teleophthalmology development in our network.

Section Title: MANAGEMENT’S DISCUSSION AND ANALYSIS OF FINANCIAL CONDITION AND RESULTS OF OPERATIONS
Subsubsection Text: Other non-recurring operating items represented a net expense of €0.6 million for the nine months ended April 30, 2024, compared to €1.4 million for the nine months ended April 30, 2023. The difference is primarily due to a charge of €0.7 million at our former headquarters in Paris, following our move to Paris La Défense in January 2023.

Section Title: MANAGEMENT’S DISCUSSION AND ANALYSIS OF FINANCIAL CONDITION AND RESULTS OF OPERATIONS
Subsubsection Text: As a result of the factors discussed above, operating profit increased by €1.6 million to €57.7 million for the nine months ended April 30, 2024, compared to €56.1 million for the nine months ended April 30, 2023.

Section Title: MANAGEMENT’S DISCUSSION AND ANALYSIS OF FINANCIAL CONDITION AND RESULTS OF OPERATIONS
Subsubsection Text: Our net financial expense was reduced by €6.2 million, from €33.0 million for the nine months ended April 30, 2023, to €26.8 million for the nine months ended April 30, 2024. Our financial income grew mainly as a result of the rise of interest rates over the past year, allowing us to record higher revenues on our growing cash deposits, and of the gain on our hedging on the Existing Subordinated Notes. Borrowing costs recorded a decrease of €2.2 million in the nine months ended April 30, 2024 as a result of the complete reimbursement of convertible bonds achieved in the past fiscal year, partially offset by a higher financial charge on our lease debt, following the total growth of the lease debt from a year before. Finally, other financial charges recorded savings of €0.6 million in the nine months ended April 30, 2024 compared to the same period a year before.

The Administrative Court tasked with reviewing the tax reassessment confirmed the proposed reassessment for our Group, resulting in a revision of our tax losses carried forward for a total amount of approximately €21.1 million.

Section Title: MANAGEMENT’S DISCUSSION AND ANALYSIS OF FINANCIAL CONDITION AND RESULTS OF OPERATIONS
Subsubsection Text: Historically, our liquidity requirements have arisen primarily from the need to service our indebtedness, finance working capital and fund the expansion of our store network, finance acquisitions and pay taxes. Our sources of liquidity and capital have historically consisted mainly of the following: - issuances of senior and senior subordinated debt consisting of prior issuances of high-yield notes and borrowings under the Existing Revolving Credit Facility; - shareholder injections in the form of shareholder bonds, which refer to the shareholder convertible bonds that were previously issued by the Issuer and held by certain shareholders. - certain other bilateral credit facilities permitted sale of discounted receivables from franchisees (cessions Dailly), finance leases and factoring of CIR-related receivables; and - cash generated from operating activities. Our principal sources of liquidity are cash flows from operating activities and the Existing Revolving Credit Facility. The majority of our indebtedness is represented by the Existing Notes. We continue to marginally access certain uncommitted short-term discount lines (assignment of trade receivables), overdrafts and medium-term bilateral loans, factoring programs and financial leases as business needs dictate, in particular for store renovations (mainly for directly-owned stores) and key money expense. Following the Offering, our principal sources of liquidity will be cash flow from operating activities and the New Revolving Credit Facility. The Group’s franchise/asset-light model generates strong levels of operating cash flows, with only limited working capital and capital expenditure requirements. The majority of our indebtedness will be represented by the Notes offered hereby. Additionally, we will continue to access certain uncommitted short-term discount lines (assignment of trade receivables), overdrafts, medium-term bilateral loans and financial leases as business needs dictate, in particular for store renovations (mainly for directly-owned stores) and key money. Finally, the Group will maintain a network of directly-owned stores and will consequently have lease arrangements on its owned stores and certain administrative premises, representing total right-of-use assets under IFRS 16 of €72.2 million, and lease debt (net of sublease arrangements) of €82.1 million as of April 30, 2024. See “Capitalization” and “Description of Certain Other Indebtedness and Other Arrangements”. The sources of our working capital requirements include: - requirements relating to sales of goods in our wholesale activity with our networks. In connection with our exclusive frames trading business and central purchasing unit sales, we recognize significant trade receivables in relation to our franchisees, as well as in relation to our partners distributing the exclusive frames. Furthermore, optical sales to end-consumers via directly-owned stores in France generate customer credit for an estimated period of between 15 days and one month following the sale, due to the third-party payment system that is used in the French optical sector (tiers payant); - inventories, mainly in directly-owned stores. Inventories may vary depending on the arrival of new collections, particularly with regard to sunglasses. We also store products to be sold to franchisees as part of the rollout of new collections; and ----- - requirements generated by central listing and payment unit arrangements, whereby we pay suppliers on behalf of franchisees. Such mechanisms normally generate a time lag of 15 days to one month between payment to suppliers and payment by franchisees in respect of the goods concerned. In addition, in the event of late payments, we sometimes grant franchised stores more flexible payment deadlines, which further increases working capital requirements.

Subsubsection Text: (1) Following our decision to progressively discontinue our Optical Discount brand, which resulted in a reduction to 22 stores bearing the Optical Discount banner as at July 31, 2023, Optical Discount activities (which we plan to progressively terminate by the end of 2024) are treated as discontinued operations in the audited consolidated financial statements for our fiscal year ended July 31, 2023 and our unaudited condensed interim consolidated financial information for the nine months ended April 30, 2024. For comparison purposes, the comparative income statement and statement of cash flows columns setting forth our financial information for the fiscal year ended July 31, 2022 and the nine months ended April 30, 2023 were restated with Optical Discount as discontinued operations. No restatement of balance sheet information was performed, in accordance with IFRS 5. For further information, see “—Factors affecting the comparability of our results of _operations—Changes in our scope of consolidation” and note 4.3.1 to our audited consolidated financial statements for the_ fiscal year ended July 31, 2023 included elsewhere in this Offering Memorandum. In the fiscal year ended July 31, 2021, cash flow before borrowing costs amounted to €90.7 million. Cash flow before borrowing costs, compared to operating performance as measured at the Adjusted EBITDA level amounting to €100.7 million, was mainly impacted by management exit bonuses and monitoring fees for €5.1 million, other financial charges for €0.8 million, and other exceptional items, including the cost of departure of our former CEO for €2.1 million. In the fiscal year ended July 31, 2022, cash flow before borrowing costs amounted to €99.4 million compared to €90.7 million for the fiscal year ended July 31, 2021, broadly reflecting the positive evolution of our operating profitability, as shown by Adjusted EBITDA amounting to €106.9 million compared to €100.7 million for the fiscal year ended July 31, 2021. Cash flow before borrowing costs, compared to operating performance as measured at the Adjusted EBITDA level amounting to €106.9 million, was mainly impacted by management exit bonuses and monitoring fees of €2.4 million, other financial charges for €2.7 million, and other exceptional items, including the cost of the two DOS perimeters acquired during the prior fiscal year, and a potential transaction in Italy, which was finally aborted. In the fiscal year ended July 31, 2023, cash flow before borrowing costs amounted to €109.8 million, compared to €99.4 million for the fiscal year ended July 31, 2022, broadly reflecting the positive ----- evolution of our operating profitability, as shown by Adjusted EBITDA, amounting to €114.4 million compared to €106.9 million for the fiscal year ended July 31, 2022. Cash flow before borrowing costs, compared to operating performance as measured at the Adjusted EBITDA level amounting to €109.8 million, was mainly impacted by management exit bonuses and monitoring fees of €1.5 million, other financial net charges for €1.5 million, and other exceptional items (including expenses linked to our former headquarters in Paris). For the nine months ended April 30, 2024, cash flow before borrowing costs amounted to €86.2 million, compared to €78.4 million for the nine months ended April 30, 2023. Cash flow before borrowing costs compared to operating performance at the Adjusted EBITDA level amounting to €86.1 million was impacted by monitoring fees of €1.0 million to our shareholders, which was offset by various items, including the impact of foreign exchange (euro versus dollar). _Change in working capital requirements_ The following table sets out changes in working capital requirements in the fiscal years ended July 31, 2023, 2022 and 2021 and during the nine months ended April 30, 2024 and 2023.

Section Title: MANAGEMENT’S DISCUSSION AND ANALYSIS OF FINANCIAL CONDITION AND RESULTS OF OPERATIONS
Subsubsection Text: (1) Following our decision to progressively discontinue our Optical Discount brand, which resulted in a reduction to 22 stores bearing the Optical Discount banner as at July 31, 2023, Optical Discount activities (which we plan to progressively terminate by the end of 2024) are treated as discontinued operations in the audited consolidated financial statements for our fiscal year ended July 31, 2023 and our unaudited condensed interim consolidated financial information for the nine months ended April 30, 2024. For comparison purposes, the comparative income statement and statement of cash flows columns setting forth our financial information for the fiscal year ended July 31, 2022 and the nine months ended April 30, 2023 were restated with Optical Discount as discontinued operations. No restatement of balance sheet information was performed, in accordance with IFRS 5. For further information, see “—Factors affecting the comparability of our results of _operations—Changes in our scope of consolidation” and note 4.3.1 to our audited consolidated financial statements for the_ fiscal year ended July 31, 2023 included elsewhere in this Offering Memorandum. In the fiscal year ended July 31, 2021, change in working capital generated a strong positive cash flow of €37.2 million, compared to a slightly negative cash flow of €2.6 million for the fiscal year ended July 31, 2020. The main factor is the complete reimbursement of the support provided to our franchisees during the confinement period for a total amount of €25.5 million during the fiscal year, along with the continued improvement of receivables of our franchisees over the last several years. Also, our inventories were reduced by €5.3 million, mostly at our trading activity, part of which was due to the phasing of our new collections, which were slightly delayed and thus did not weigh on our total inventories, at the end of the fiscal year. Finally, the impact of the COVID-19 pandemic on our working capital is now broadly balanced between a few pending items (mostly rent) and receivables related to government subsidies. In the fiscal year ended July 31, 2022, change in working capital generated a positive cash flow of €3.1 million compared to a positive cash flow of €37.2 million for the fiscal year ended July 31, 2021, which was primarily linked to the reimbursement of the support granted to our franchisees during the first COVID-19 confinement. The franchisees’ position towards the Group continued to improve, especially in France, where our networks reached historical financial soundness. Indeed, as at July 31, 2022, there was no debt outstanding owed by our franchisees, which we had previously extended during the COVID-19 pandemic. The rest of our working capital requirements evolution includes temporary items linked to the activity of the Group at the end of the prior fiscal year, which were balanced in coming subsequent quarters. ----- In the fiscal year ended July 31, 2023, change in working capital generated a negative cash outflow of €11.4 million, compared to a positive cash flow of €3.1 million in the fiscal year ended July 31, 2022. This change mainly included (i) an increase in our inventories linked to the postponement of the launch of our own exclusive frames display in our network, (ii) a temporary growth linked to the acceleration of sales in June and July, (iii) management bonuses that were repaid at the end of July 2023 (see, “Principal Shareholders and Related Party Transactions—Management Incentive Plan”) and (iv) the increase of trade payables related to devices for teleophthalmology, which have been paid by the Group and will be repaid by franchisees within 60 months. The franchisee position towards the Group continued to stand well in our main geographical areas with historical financial soundness. During the nine months ended April 30, 2024, change in working capital requirements amounted to an outflow of €5.5 million compared to €0.5 million for the nine months ended April 30, 2023. Our working capital requirements remained in line with the levels of the prior comparable period; however, capital requirements in March and April were impacted due to the seasonal impacts of certain products, such as our frames and sunglasses payment flow. _Income tax paid_ In the fiscal year ended July 31, 2021, income tax paid corresponded to an outflow of €1.5 million at a lower level than the year before, as the payments made in the current year generally correspond to the past year performance, which was heavily impacted by the COVID-19 pandemic. In the fiscal year ended July 31, 2022, income tax paid corresponded to an outflow of €7.4 million, as the payments made in the current year generally correspond to the past year performance. In the fiscal year ended July 31, 2023, income tax paid corresponded to an outflow of €8.9 million, as the payments made in the current year generally correspond to the past year performance. For the nine months ended April 30, 2024, income tax paid was €5.0 million, which included a reimbursement on early payments of taxes made the year before, which were in excess to the annual charge.

Section Title: MANAGEMENT’S DISCUSSION AND ANALYSIS OF FINANCIAL CONDITION AND RESULTS OF OPERATIONS
Subsubsection Text: In the fiscal year ended July 31, 2021, investing activities represented an outflow of €21.4 million compared to €9.3 million for the fiscal year ended July 31, 2020. It included: - an outflow of €11.3 million on purchases of intangible assets, relating mainly to set-up costs and IT systems upgrade and maintenance costs of €9.2 million during the year, linked to our digital transformation plan, and €2.1 million mainly corresponding to store goodwill acquired at our directly-owned stores perimeter; ----- - a net outflow of €11.0 million related to purchases of property, plant and equipment, which again include expenses for €4.4 million at the franchisor’s level in France and Spain, mainly corresponding to our digital transformation, and €7.1 million of expenses at our directly-owned stores also in France and Spain, mostly following the integration of new stores in the directly-owned stores perimeter; - a net outflow of €1.9 million relating to financial assets, mainly corresponding to the balance between long-term commitments granted to franchisees (vendor credits and loans linked to the sale of directly-owned stores and long-term investments supporting franchisees through our Adelante program) and the reimbursement of such commitments by our franchisees; the Adelante program has been marked in the prior fiscal year by a specific transaction representing a €2.5 million support to a franchisee buying back a perimeter of six stores representing approximately €9.0 million of sales from a former franchisee in the south of France; - payments in relation to sub-lease agreements, for a whole amount of €3.8 million, at the same amount as in the prior fiscal year, which has its counterpart in the debt service related to right-ofuse assets in financing activities; and - a net outflow of €0.4 million mainly related to the acquisition of a company managing a store in France and the last payment on Optivisao’s disposal. In the fiscal year ended July 31, 2022, investing activities represented an outflow of €20.0 million compared to €21.4 million for the previous year. It included: - an outflow of €11.7 million on purchases of intangible assets, relating mainly to set-up costs, and IT system upgrade and maintenance costs of €10.2 million during the year, linked to our digital transformation plan, and €1.4 million mainly corresponding to store goodwill acquired at our directly-owned stores perimeter; - a net outflow of €5.4 million related on one side to purchases for €9.8 million of property, plant and equipment for €7.1 million at our D.O.S (mainly composed of refurbishment expenses of stores and the development of audio corners inside the Spanish DOS) and €2.7 million at the franchisor level, mainly covering maintenance capex (such as the renovation of the headquarters in Spain) and on the other side, an inflow of €4.4 million linked to the resale of several stores to franchisees (including one rapid sale of a store in Normandy); - a net outflow of €6.8 million (aggregating purchase and proceeds of investments, and purchase of subsidiaries net of cash acquired) relating to €5.5 million of purchases of subsidiaries net of cash acquired, corresponding to the aforementioned acquisition of eight stores in Bordeaux during the first quarter of the fiscal year, and the acquisition of 12 stores in Normandy, during the second quarter of the fiscal year, and an outflow of €1.3 million being the balance between long-term commitments granted to franchisees (vendor credits and loans linked to the sale of directly-owned stores and long-term investments supporting franchisees through our Adelante program) and the reimbursement of such commitments by our franchisees; and - payments in relation to sub-lease agreements, for an amount of €4.0 million, at a close level to the prior fiscal year, which has its counterpart in the debt service related to right-of-use assets in financing activities. In the fiscal year ended July 31, 2023, investing activities represented an outflow of €18.3 million compared to €20.0 million a year before. It included: - an outflow of €13.2 million on purchases of intangible assets, relating mainly to costs associated with our digital transformation plan (including set-up costs, maintenance costs and costs related to the upgrade of our IT system) of €11.1 million during the year and €2.1 million mainly corresponding to store goodwill acquired at our directly-owned stores perimeters; - a net outflow of €7.3 million related to (i) €11.5 million of purchases of property, plant and equipment, of which €4.6 million was spent on our directly-owned stores perimeter (including ----- specific expenses of €0.9 million at our French stores dedicated to teleophthalmology), mainly composed of refurbishment expenses of stores and the development of audio corners inside the Spanish stores, and €6.9 million at the franchisor level, mainly covering capex linked to our headquarters move to Paris La Défense and renovation in Spain, for a total of €2.7 million and acquisition on behalf of franchisees of machines for our teleophthalmology solution, representing €2.5 million, as well as (ii) an inflow of €4.2 million linked mainly to the resale of several stores to franchisees, mostly following the acquisition of 12 stores in Normandy; - a net outflow of €2.0 million (aggregating purchase and proceeds of investments and purchase of subsidiaries net of cash acquired) relating to €0.5 million of purchases of subsidiaries net of cash acquired, corresponding to the final settlement of the acquisition of 12 stores in Normandy, during the second quarter of the prior fiscal year, and an outflow of €1.5 million reflecting the balance between long-term commitments granted to franchisees (vendor credits and loans linked to the sale of directly-owned stores and long-term investments supporting franchisees through our Adelante program) and the reimbursement of such commitments by our franchisees; and - payments in relation to sub-lease agreements, for an amount of €4.2 million, at close to the level of the prior fiscal year, which has its counterpart in the debt service related to right-of-use assets in financing activities. For the nine months ended April 30, 2024, investing activities represented an outflow of €7.1 million compared to €11.3 million in the nine months ended April 30, 2023. This included: - an outflow of €7.7 million on purchases of intangible assets, relating mainly to set up costs and IT system on the franchisor’s side, and to expenses of €0.7 million at our directly-owned stores in Spain; - an outflow of €7.0 million related to purchases of property, plant and equipment, which included €2.2 million of expenses at the franchisor level in France and Spain (including teleophthalmology devices on behalf of the whole network for €0.9 million), and maintenance capital expenditures for €4.8 million at our directly-owned stores (also including specific teleophthalmology devices for €0.6 million), balanced by an inflow of €4.3 million linked to stores sales for €4.1 million (of which €3.4 million were in France, following our strategy to reduce the perimeter of directly-owned stores); - a net outflow of €0.4 million relating to financial assets, corresponding to the balance between long-term commitments granted to franchisees (vendor credits and loans linked to the sale of directly-owned stores and long-term investments supporting franchisees through our Adelante program) and the reimbursement of such commitments; and - payments in relation to sub-lease agreements for €3.5 million (post-IFRS 16), which had its counterpart in the debt service related to right of use assets in financing activities and an inflow of €0.2 million received from the resolution of litigation with a real estate company, relating to the Normandy perimeter acquired two years before.

Section Title: MANAGEMENT’S DISCUSSION AND ANALYSIS OF FINANCIAL CONDITION AND RESULTS OF OPERATIONS
Subsubsection Text: As of April 30, 2024, consolidated total principal amount of debt of the Issuer and its subsidiaries amounted to €642.1 million and consisted mainly of the Existing Notes and lease liabilities. The following table summarizes our total contractual obligations and commitments as of April 30, 2024, giving effect to the Transactions, sorted by the year in which they are due to mature. It does not include accrued interest or lease liabilities. It also (i) does not include non-recourse factoring that is off-balance sheet and recourse discount lines that typically are paid intra-month (and in any case within 60 days) as further described under “—Off-balance sheet commitments” and (ii) assumes that the New Revolving Credit Facility will be undrawn on the Issue Date. The foregoing figures and those in the table below, which reflect a cash presentation, may not be directly comparable to those presented in our audited consolidated financial statements, which are prepared in accordance with IFRS.

Section Title: MANAGEMENT’S DISCUSSION AND ANALYSIS OF FINANCIAL CONDITION AND RESULTS OF OPERATIONS
Subsubsection Text: ----- The net cash used in financing activities represented an outflow of €143.4 million in the fiscal year ended July 31, 2021, compared to €8.4 million for the fiscal year ended July 31, 2020. It included the main following items: - new debt for an amount of €485.0 million, corresponding to the refinancing of the Group on May 19, 2021; - repayments of loans along with the refinancing of the Group, for a total amount of €595.5 million, including mainly €415.0 million of outstanding senior secured notes at the date of the refinancing, €30.0 million of government-backed loans _Prêt Garanti par l’Etat, €135.0 million of shareholder convertible bonds, and the impact of reclassification of a portion of convertible bonds to equity after the extension of their maturity, and €15.2 million of lease debt repayments; - €0.1 million of other financial expenses; - debt issuance costs of €7.8 million linked to the refinancing with the Existing Notes (excluding the Tap Notes), for a total amount of €485.0 million; and - interest paid of €25.2 million, of which €17.4 million was for the service of our high-yield debt (before and after refinancing), €2.5 million as early repayment penalties of 1% on our then outstanding senior secured fixed rate notes, €4.4 million of interest charges on lease debt and €0.9 million corresponding to various other interest charges. The net cash used in financing activities represented an outflow of €58.4 million in the fiscal year ended July 31, 2022, which included the main following items: - an inflow of €50.1 million of loans, corresponding mainly to €50.0 million of the Tap Notes; - an outflow of €47.7 million corresponding to a contribution to shareholders, enabled by the issuance of the Tap Notes in February 2022; - repayment of loans for €28.1 million, corresponding mainly to the reimbursement of €11.5 million of convertible bonds to our shareholders, being part of the distribution to shareholders of €59.2 million financed by the issuance of €50.0 million of the Tap Notes issued in February 2022 and the net repayment of lease liabilities for €16.2 million; - debt issuance costs of €2.9 million, mainly linked to the issuance of €50 million of the Tap Notes and payment of remaining costs on the Group’s refinancing in May 2021; and - interest paid of €29.7 million, of which €24.7 million was for the service of our senior secured notes and secured notes (before and after refinancing) and €5.1 million of interest charge on lease debt. The net cash used in financing activities represented an outflow of €51.4 million in the fiscal year ended July 31, 2023, which reflected the following changes compared to the year prior: - no inflow of loans, compared to €50.0 million of the Tap Notes raised in the fiscal year ended July 31, 2022, which were balanced by an outflow of €47.7 million corresponding to a contribution to shareholders; - repayment of loans of €17.6 million, relating mostly to the net repayment of lease liabilities for €15.3 million and the repayment of a PGE loan of directly-owned stores bought back in the prior year; - debt issuance costs of €0.2 million, which relate to our high-yield debt; and - interest paid for €33.6 million, of which €27.5 million was for the service of our Existing and €6.1 million related to interest charge on lease debt. ----- During the nine months ended April 30, 2024, financing activities represented an outflow of €38.5 million compared to an outflow of €33.9 million during the nine months ended April 30, 2023. This outflow includes €5.2 million of dividends distributed to certain shareholders, linked to the evolution of the ownership of our Group. The balance between loans and repayment of loans represented an outflow of €10.5 million, mainly corresponding to lease liability repayments compared to €13.9 million for the nine months ended April 30, 2023 (which included €1.2 million for reimbursement of governmentbacked loans and €1.0 million for reimbursement of convertible bonds). On the other hand, the net interest paid increased to €22.8 million in the nine months ended April 30, 2024 compared to €19.8 million for the nine months ended April 30, 2023, following the increase of our total financial debt at the start of the 2022 calendar year, and the impact of the rise in interest rates from the end of the 2022 calendar year.
